result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Response to State's Discovery Demand
Return date on January 9, 2023 at 01:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for NICHOLAS J BUNKER
Current: 571 Cty Rd A, C/O Green Lake County Jail, Green Lake, WI 54941 United States  (Effective: 10-18-2022)
Prior: 135 W Huron St Apt A, Berlin, WI 54923

9:43 AM Defendant NICHOLAS J BUNKER in court, in custody.  Attorney Jesse Frank Schwartz appeared by video for NICHOLAS J BUNKER.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 22CF49, 22CF162 and 22CF180. 

For cases 22CF162 and 22CF180. Atty Schwartz confirms receipt of the criminal complaints and waives their readings. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count for each case and as repeaters. ADA makes bond recommendation. Court notes bond has been set in 22CF162. 22CF180 - Court sets bond at $500 signature bond and conditions of: Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. 22CF162 - Court orders bond to remain as is. Atty Schwartz states the defendant will waive the preliminary hearings in both cases. Defendant concurs. 

Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony has been committed and that the felony probably was committed by the defendant and binds the defendant over for trial. State files an information with the court for 22CF162 and 22CF180 and confirms they mirror their complaints.. Attorney Schwartz acknowledges receipts of the information and waives their reading.  Court will set all cases for Return date January 9, 2023 at 1:00 PM.  OFF THE RECORD 9:50 AM BACK ON THE RECORD 9:50 AM. Same appearances. Atty Schwartz enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant for 22CF162 and 22CF180.

Court adjourned at  9:51 AM.
Instructions for How to Appear Remotely - Atty Schwartz
Request for Defense Counsel to Appear Via Zoom

Court instructs the defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court, same as the criminal complaint and shows to Aty Schwartz. Attorney Schwartz waives any reading. Atty Schwartz enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
1:01 PM Defendant NICHOLAS J BUNKER in court.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he'd like to get an attorney and would like to wait to proceed with the preliminary hearing. Defendant waives the time limits for the prelim. Court schedules Status of Counsel for May 3, 2022 at 10:00 AM.

Court adjourned at 1:02 PM.
Second appearance scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Second appearance on May 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant called and stated that when they were coming back from an appointment his vehicle brakes locked and his vehicle has been impounded and does not have the money to get it. Also questioned the defendant he provided the information to the PD's office and he stated he did not as he did not receive it until friday and was waiting for the library to open at nine to fax it to the PD's office. Informed the defendant that he needed to appear as the time limits were not waived and chances were that an attorney would not be appointed for today's hearing..

10:04 AM Defendant NICHOLAS J BUNKER in court.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he is going to be getting an attorney for this case. Further statement by defendant - public defender's office states the def needs to provide proof of no employment in order to qualify. Court notes def did not waive time limits for the prelim. Def states he'd like an attorney before he proceeds. Court will leave the prelim scheduled on April 4. 

Court adjourned at 10:07 AM.
Status hearing on March 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:59 AM Defendant NICHOLAS J BUNKER in court.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count and as repeater. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  ADA makes bond recommendation. Court notes bond has been set and will leave bond as previously set. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant does not waive the time limits. 

Court adjourned at 10:02 AM.
